title: What is Phishing?
content: Phishing is a type of cyberattack where attackers trick users into revealing sensitive information like passwords or credit card details by pretending to be legitimate organizations.

title: Urgency & Pressure
content: Attackers create a sense of urgency, such as warning about account suspension, to rush victims into making mistakes.

title: Passwords & Personal Info
content: Never share your passwords or personal details via email. Legitimate companies never ask for this information.

title: Attachments & Downloads
content: Avoid downloading unexpected attachments or clicking random links. Always verify the sender first.

title: What To Do If You Clicked
content: If you accidentally click a phishing link, disconnect from the internet and report the incident immediately to your IT team or service provider.
